<!-- html markup same as ltr -->
<div class="cmx-avatar-manipulator">
    <div class="cmx-avatar-manipulator__mask">
        <img class="cmx-avatar-manipulator__image" src=<%= require("./images/uploaded-picture-2.jpg") %> alt="profile picture" />
    </div>
    <div class="spacer-32"></div>
    <div class="cmx-avatar-clipping-slider">
        <div class="cmx-avatar-clipping-slider__col">
            <span class="cmx-icon-picture cmx-avatar-clipping-slider__icon--small"></span>
        </div>
        <div class="cmx-avatar-clipping-slider__col">
            <input id="pictureSizeSlider" class="cmx-slider" type="range" min="100" max="200" value="100">
            <script>
                if ((/Chrome/.test(navigator.userAgent) && /Google Inc/.test(navigator.vendor))||(/Safari/.test(navigator.userAgent) && /Apple Computer/.test(navigator.vendor))){
                    var slider = document.getElementById('pictureSizeSlider');
                    var updateSliderTrack = function(e,tgt){
                        var t;
                        if (typeof(tgt)!=='undefined'){
                            t = tgt;
                        } else {
                            t = e.target;
                        }
                        

                        var minVal = t.min;
                        var maxVal = t.max;
                        var val = t.value;

                        var pc = ((val-minVal)*100) / (maxVal-minVal);
                        pc = Math.ceil(pc);

                        t.setAttribute('class','cmx-slider cmx-slider--pc-' + pc);
                    };
                    updateSliderTrack(null,slider);
                    slider.addEventListener('input',updateSliderTrack);
                    slider.addEventListener('change',updateSliderTrack);
                }
            </script>
        </div>
        <div class="cmx-avatar-clipping-slider__col">
            <span class="cmx-icon-picture cmx-avatar-clipping-slider__icon--large"></span>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

// Small partial appended for override.
// _avatar-rtl.scss


// we have changed the slider from a fake one to a real input type="range", which is available in HTML5
html[dir="rtl"] .cmx-slider {
    
    // since webkit doesnt have fill upper or fill lower to have a different color in the range and the remainant we hack it through CSS gradients and javascript;
    @for $i from 0 through 100 {
        &--pc-#{$i}::-webkit-slider-runnable-track {
            background: linear-gradient(to left, $bright-blue 0%,$bright-blue 0%+$i, $table-highlight-grey 0%+$i,$table-highlight-grey 100%); // modified
        }
    }
  }
